Lyrics: Como Santa María guareceu a reínna Dona Beatriz de grand' enfermidade, porque aorou a sa omage con grand' esperança.
Direct Translation: How Holy Mary cured Queen Beatriz of a grave illness because she prayed to her image in great hope.

Lyrics: Quen na Virgen grorïosa | esperança mui grand' á,
Direct Translation: If one has great hope in the Glorious Virgin,
Poetic Translation: Place your hope upon the Virgin, Her whose Glory angels tell;

Lyrics: macar seja muit' enfermo, | ela mui ben o guarrá.
Direct Translation: although he be very ill, She will cure him.
Poetic Translation: Even if you're sick and dying, She will surely make you well.

Lyrics: E dest' un mui gran miragre | vos quéro dizer que vi,
Direct Translation: Concerning this, I wish to tell you a very great miracle
Poetic Translation: Holy Mary worked a wonder I will praise forevermore,

Lyrics: e pero éra meninno, | membra-me que foi assí,
Direct Translation: which Holy Mary performed, as She has done before and will do again.
Poetic Translation: As She will do in the future And as She has done before.

Lyrics: ca m' estava éu deante | e todo vi e oí,
Direct Translation: Although I was a little boy, I remember it happened like this,
Poetic Translation: I was young, but I remember, For I stood outside the door,

Lyrics: que fezo Santa María, | que muitos fez e fará.
Direct Translation: for I was present and saw and heard everything.
Poetic Translation: Seeing, hearing all that happened, Everything that then befell.

Lyrics: Esto foi en aquel ano | quand' o mui bon Rei gãou,
Direct Translation: This happened in that year when the good King
Poetic Translation: In the year King Don Fernando, Good and loved by all of Spain,

Lyrics: Don Fernando, a Capéla | e de crischãos poblou;
Direct Translation: don Fernando won Capilla and settled it with Christians.
Poetic Translation: Won Capilla for the Christians, Settled it as his domain,

Lyrics: e sa mollér, a Reínna | Dona Beatriz, mandou
Direct Translation: He ordered his wife, the Queen doña Beatriz,
Poetic Translation: To the queen he sent a message, Asking that while he campaigned

Lyrics: que fosse morar en Conca, | enquant' el foi acolá
Direct Translation: to go and stay in Cuenca while he went
Poetic Translation: She to Cuenca travel safely: Doña Beatriz, fare well.

Lyrics: Aa óst'. E séu mandado | fez ela mui volontér;
Direct Translation: to attack Capilla. She carried out his order willingly,
Poetic Translation: She obeyed without a murmur, With a calm and placid will.

Lyrics: e quando foi na cidade, | peor enferma mollér
Direct Translation: and when she arrived at the city, you never saw a sicker woman than she was,
Poetic Translation: But when she arrived in Cuenca, All could see she'd fallen ill.

Lyrics: non vistes do que foi ela; | ca pero de Monpislér
Direct Translation: for although there were competent doctors from Montpellier there,
Poetic Translation: From Montpellier came doctors, Healers of unequaled skill,

Lyrics: bõos físicos i éran, | dizían: "Non viverá."
Direct Translation: they said: "She will not live."
Poetic Translation: And I heard them tell each other, "She will not survive this hell."

Lyrics: E por que esto dizían | non éra mui sen razôn,
Direct Translation: And it was not without reason that they said this,
Poetic Translation: And the doctors spoke with reason: She was ill without a doubt,

Lyrics: ca d' aver ela séu fillo | estava ena sazôn;
Direct Translation: for it was time for her to bear her child,
Poetic Translation: For the time of birth was on her, But the child would not come out

Lyrics: e avía tan gran féver, | que quena viía entôn
Direct Translation: and she had such a great fever that anyone who saw her then
Poetic Translation: And she had so great a fever, All who came there hung about,

Lyrics: dizía: "Seguramente, | desta non escapará."
Direct Translation: would say: "Surely she will not escape this time."
Poetic Translation: Whispering, "There's no escaping." No one could her pain dispell.

Lyrics: Mas la Reínna, que sérva | éra da que pód' e val,
Direct Translation: However, the queen, who was a servant of Her who is powerful and ready,
Poetic Translation: But the queen, who was a servant Of the One with ready might,

Lyrics: Virgen santa grorïosa, | Reínna espirital,
Direct Translation: the Glorious Holy Virgin, Spiritual Queen,
Poetic Translation: Virgin Glorious and Holy, Queen of Spirit and of Light,

Lyrics: fez trager ũa omagen, | mui ben feita de metal,
Direct Translation: had an image of Holy Mary, finely wrought of metal, brought
Poetic Translation: Had an image of the Virgin, Finely wrought of metal bright,

Lyrics: de Santa Marí' e disse: | "Esta cabo mi será.
Direct Translation: and said: "This shall be by my side,
Poetic Translation: Brought and laid beside her, saying, "This I'll keep within my cell.

Lyrics: Ca pois éu a sa fegura | vir, atal creença ei
Direct Translation: "for hwen I see Her likeness, I have such strong belief
Poetic Translation: "For each time I see Her likeness, Faith within me grows so great,

Lyrics: que de todos estes maes | que atán tóste guarrei;
Direct Translation: that I shall soon recover from all these afflictions.
Poetic Translation: I believe I will recover From this pale and deathly state:

Lyrics: porend' a mi a chegade | e lógo lle beijarei
Direct Translation: Therefore, bring it close to me, and I shall kiss
Poetic Translation: Bring it close, oh, bring it closer; I will kiss Her while I wait,

Lyrics: as sas mãos e os pées, | ca mui gran pról me terrá."
Direct Translation: Her hands and Her feet, for it will do me great good."
Poetic Translation: Kiss Her feet and kiss Her fingers: All my pain Her comforts quell."

Lyrics: E tod' est' assí foi feito; | e lógo, sen outra ren,
Direct Translation: All this was done, and then, without any other treatment,
Poetic Translation: So they brought the Virgin's image, And the queen her prayers outpoured.

Lyrics: de todos aqueles maes | guariu a Reínna tan ben
Direct Translation: by the power of the Glorious Lady, the queen recovered from all those afflictions
Poetic Translation: With no other cure or treatment, By the power of the Lord,

Lyrics: per poder da Grorïosa, | que nada non sentiu ên.
Direct Translation: so completely that she felt no effects from them.
Poetic Translation: There was born a healthy baby, And my mother was restored.

Lyrics: Porên será de mal siso | o que a non loará.
Direct Translation: Hence he who will not praise Her will be most unwise.
Poetic Translation: He who will not praise the Virgin Scorns the chance to be made well.

Lyrics: Alfonso X el Sabio, King of Castile and León
Direct Translation: Alfonso. Songs of Holy Mary of Alfonso X, the Wise: A Translation of the Cantigas de Santa Maria. Trans. Kathleen Kulp-Hill. Tempe, AZ: Arizona Center for Medieval and Renaissance Studies, 2000. Print.
